column4: HI Guys, I am new to torrent, how do i run the bit torrent porgram what's the command please, I can not find it in application menu
well what client did you install?
bittorrent was installed with Ubuntu
ok, then it should be in the menu, applications/internet
it is not there, I can it installed with add/remove program though
right click on Applications menu, choose Edit Menu, then go down to Internet, and look and see if you need to put a checkmark next to it.
whats that driver for?
Thanks a lot mate, done now
ok
BUT bit torrent isnt a very good torrent client in Linux, at least in my opinion, I'd look at either Transmission, or using Utorrent in Wine
never tried rtorrent
thanks for the heads up, i was looking for utorrent for linux, i saw one for wine
its easy to install w/ wine
i have never used wine, i am newbie
are you familiar w/ utorrent?
damn, netsplit at 6am?... thats a new one
oh ok..
yes i used utorrent with vista
yeah jjst caught that.
ok, go here, http://www.winehq.org
once there, click on get wine now, then clcik on "ubuntu", and follow the directions to add the wine repository and install wine.. then i'll tell you how to install utorrent if you want
thanks bud, i am going to get utorrent for wine. Nice one X10 Regards
its really the best *linux* torrent client if you ask me
